attributes.action: Review laws governing trampolines in gardens (height & proximity to boundaries.
attributes.additional_details:
There are numerous cases in chat websites complaining about the noise & invasion of privacy, 
https://www.weeklygripe.co.uk/no-privacy-with-kids-trampoline-in-the-garden
https://www.gardenlaw.co.uk/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=9922

Other countries are starting to take measures to curb this antisocial nuisance - they UK should consider this:
https://www.thelocal.dk/20180615/danish-housing-association-bans-trampolines-to-keep-noisy-kids-quiet
attributes.background: Children to scream & shriek whilst using them (noise pollution) they are often above fence level & this is a violation of personal privacy.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. In particular, we're not sure whether you'd like to introduce new laws to govern the use of trampolines or whether you'd like the Government to review existing privacy laws.   

If you are concerned about noise and your privacy, you may wish to consider complaining to your local council, you can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/report-noise-pollution-to-council
https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/housing/problems-where-you-live/complaining-about-your-neighbour/

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
